name: Imperia Online
description: Experience vast amount of gameplay mechanics and compete with thousands of players in a totally realistic medieval strategic simulation!
minimum_requirements: OS: 10/8/8.1/7 32/64 bit Processor: CPU Intel Pentium D 2.66GHz Memory: 1000 MB RAM Graphics: Graphics Intel HD Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 160 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: 10/8/8.1/7 32/64 bit Processor: CPU Intel Core i3 3GHz Memory: 2000 MB RAM Graphics: Graphics Intel HD 4000 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 250 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Good MMo Time strategy game with everything for you to like it.
It's like Evony without the sexy ladies
1. Download 2. Play 3. Clicked Log-in with Steam 4. Game said 'You have logged out successfully.' 5. ???? 6. Closed and re open it. 7. Still saying 'You have logged out successfully.' 8. Uninstall
Facebook game Window fullscreen you can't press alt+enter to have this game in fullscreen... Uninstall

This is honestly not bad for a browser game and costing $0. It has an interesting dynasty mechanic which is more than I could say for Rome 2 Total War when it was first released and I wasted $50 on. It also has a fun and somewhat believable market system and decent visualized battle calculation which is more than I can say for Grand Ages Medieval on which I also wasted another $50. The reason I thumb this down is because it belongs on my browser. NOT on STEAM where it insults quality games such as Crusader Kings 2 by even being listed here.
+graphics is beautiful -interesting objectives but lack of hints made us clueless

Well, it's kind of like a facebook-style pay-for-speedups type of 'strategy' game, but with very little strategy imo, just lots of tedious leveling and researching of technologies, etc. When you attack an enemy, your victory or defeat will be displayed on a summary screen, with no combat displayed. I stepped out of the room for a minute and when I came back the game screen was completely white. If you like this type of game, then more power to ya, but personally its not for me, especially when there are better types of games out there. There is a free to play version of Age of Empires out there still (I think) google that and check it out for kicks.
